17/ want to learn more?

i highly recommend watching this video on the future of youtube NFTs by colin & samir
https://t.co/RgYEfpZILM

16/ epiphany

you should have ownership of what you create & you sell what you own

these are the ingredients for ecosystems to emerge online, this is what the metaverse is supposed to be

i could be wrong but, doesnâ€™t that sound amazing?

15/ other options

you should be financially rewarded for the value you bring to social platforms

sure, thereâ€™s Patreon for the super fans & a tip-jar on some peopleâ€™s Twitter profiles, but the social network advertising model is wearing out

14/ how do we get there?

well, letâ€™s be honest, youâ€™re reading this on Twitter

unless social platforms like @twitter @youtube @tiktok @instagram change their business model, weâ€™ll be stuck here in web2

& thereâ€™s a high probability that social networks stay in the realm of web2

13.1/ whatâ€™s a hardware wallet?

â€a hardware wallet is a small device that isolates your private keys (your credentials) from the internet, mitigating the risks of your assets being compromised in an online attack.â€

https://t.co/wyhp3NwirW

13/ true ownership

social accounts + hardware wallets = true ownership

the key difference is how weâ€™re authenticating transactions on the server

- web2 is centralized (your credentials exist on a server)
- web3 is decentralized (your credentials can exist on a hardware wallet)

11/ and the crazy thing is...

you donâ€™t have to own the content to view it!

anybody in the world is free to see it but only 1 person can own it â€“ & the traffic can help increase the value of the content as more people see it

10/ gamification

if a creator posts good content & you think theyâ€™ll continue to do so for X amount of time, you can invest in them by buying a piece of content

the creator gets financial comp from the initial purchase, as well as a small % of secondary sales (typically 2-5%)

9/ â€œwhy would anybody want to buy a video/image/text?â€

well - why would anybody buy anything?

our motives to buy commodities includeÂ necessity, convenience, fomo, identity, belonging, price, obligation, fear, and happiness

8/ the commodification of content

what once looked like collecting & trading pfps might look like collecting & trading content

- publishing a video
- posting a photo
- sending a tweet

all 3 should allow you to be financially rewarded for the value you bring to each platform

7/ â€œhow can i get paid?â€

for the web3 people out there, change your view on "ERC721" tokens

weâ€™re focused on seeing NFTs as store of financial value â€” but what about the metadata stored on it? what if you could get paid for posting content?

6/ a first principles perspective

the underlying issue is the business model

- PLATFORM owns your CONTENT
- PLATFORM can sell your CONTENT

- PLATFORM owns your DATA
- PLATFORM can sell your DATA

you get no financial benefit for putting your time & energy into the system

5/ but donâ€™t we already have that?

nope!

right now, our attention is the commodity

4/ a new hope

iâ€™ve been thinking for the past 90 minutes, and iâ€™ve come to the conclusion that weâ€™re entering a new era

ladies & gentlemen iâ€™d like to introduce to you... the commodification of content!

yes! you heard it right folks!

the commodification of content!

3.1/ watch this video

i would like to explain â€œsurveillance capitalismâ€ to you but i wonâ€™t, so definitely watch this video to fully understand what is at risk

https://t.co/Qb5VCWAhch

3/ financial incentive

every social network is in business of advertising, even twitter! ğŸ˜¯

twitter auctions your data off to the highest bidder, in return for an ad on your feed

you are a commodity

2/ the web2 social network problem

1. content censorship
2. surveillance capitalism

â€surveillance capitalism is an economic system centered around the commodification of personal data with the core purpose of profit-making.â€
